name: bamboo pole production | bamboo pole | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25036/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 Kg of bamboo pole. Bamboo culm with a water content of u =80 % is used for the production of bamboo pole. The production takes place at a bamboo processing facility and includes natural drying to a final water content of u =20% and trimming of culms. The figures origin from mainly calculations and literature values.;The pole is derived directly from the bamboo culm and is usually trimmed to between 4 and 6 m and treated against fungi and pests using boric acid. Bamboo poles can be used directly for the construction of columns, beams, or struts and are also the main input for other bamboo-based construction materials (BBCM) (Vogtländer et al., 2010, Vogtländer et al., 2014).  This dataset was developed with the support of the International Organization for Bamboo and Rattan INBAR;Ref:;Vogtländer, J., P. van der Lugt, and H. Brezet, The sustainability of bamboo products for local and Western European applications. LCAs and land-use. Journal of Cleaner Production, 2010. 18(13): p. 1260-1269.;;Vogtländer, J.G., N.M. van der Velden, and P. van der Lugt, Carbon sequestration in LCA, a proposal for a new approach based on the global carbon cycle; cases on wood and on bamboo. Int. J. Life Cycle Assess., 2014. 19(1): p. 13-23.

From reception of bamboo culm and treatment products at processing facility

This activity ends with Bamboo Pole (u=20%) at the processing facility. The dataset includes the inputs for the  treatment and trimming processes, as far as they are available. The dataset includes infrastructure. Losses of boric acid to the environment are not included in the dataset. However, they are not expected to be significant.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials

exchanges.description: Considered as the most common and low impact treatment for bio-based products. The amount reflects the amount of boric acid that is actually absorbed by the poles. The treatment solution is kept in tanks where the poles are submerged, once the treatment is finished the poles are extracted and the solution is recovered
